DOC.brief_title: Continuous Infusion Ropivacaine Hydrochloride Reducing Pain After Surgery Patients With Bladder Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To determine continuous infusion local anesthesia ( CILA ) decrease post-operative pain radical cystectomy ( RC ) . II . To determine CILA reduces narcotic requirement RC . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To determine CILA decrease length-of-stay RC . II . To determine CILA improve patient satisfaction post-operative pain control RC . OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 2 arm . ARM I : Patients receive ropivacaine hydrochloride intravenously ( IV ) continuously 72 hour radical cystectomy . ARM II : Patients receive normal saline ( placebo ) IV continuously 72 hour radical cystectomy . After completion study , patient follow within 30 day .
